meanings.definition: Informal and friendly in a way that is characteristic of ordinary people.
meanings.sent1: The folksy atmosphere of the small cafe made everyone feel welcome.
meanings.sent2: She had a folksy way of telling stories that captivated her audience.
meanings.sent3: The folksy farmer joked with his chickens as he gathered eggs.
meanings.sent4: Her folksy charm was like a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The folksy music filled the room with a sense of community.

meanings.definition: Simple and unpretentious in style or manner.
meanings.sent1: The folksy decorations in the cabin gave it a cozy feel.
meanings.sent2: He preferred a folksy approach to interior design, avoiding anything too fancy.
meanings.sent3: The folksy painting of a cow wearing sunglasses always made visitors smile.
meanings.sent4: Her folksy dress sense was a breath of fresh air in the fashion world.
meanings.sent5: The folksy artwork on the walls added a touch of warmth to the room.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of rural or small-town life.
meanings.sent1: The folksy town fair was a highlight of the year for the community.
meanings.sent2: She loved the folksy traditions of her hometown, especially the annual parade.
meanings.sent3: The folksy diner served up classic comfort food with a smile.
meanings.sent4: His folksy accent reminded her of home, even though they were miles away.
meanings.sent5: The folksy market was bustling with vendors selling homemade goods.
